answers.answer: Yes the pulse pressure (66) is a little bit high, up to 40 is considered normal. However, the actual systolic and diastolic pressures are still part of the equation for risk or long term effects. Imagine someone with a blood pressure of 160/70, (pp90), then this will have far more dramatic effects on major organs over someone with a pressure of 115/49 which is quite low. So, I don't think a pulse pressure of 66 with such low pressure will cause Doctors to be too concerned.

question: my dad has CHF, emphazema, chronic kidney disease (35% gfr), COPD, and diabetes.  He was diagnosed with diastolic CHF last year.  His blood pressure has been around 115/49 with a pulse of 59.  With all of his issues, is this bp something I should be concerned about.  I have been reading that a wide pulse pressure is a danger sign for heart attack or stroke.  any info will be a huge help. ThanksVRC5236
title: 78 yr old with 115/49 bp
